channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Speedy LA fire clean-up hailed as 'historic', safety questioned
item.description: Local and federal officials in LA say recovery from January's deadly wildfires is on pace to be the fastest in modern California history. Scientists w...

item.title: The GOP megabill is moving to the Senate, where big changes could be in store
item.description: GOP leaders hope to have the sweeping bill to President Trump's desk by July 4, but some Senate Republicans are speaking out about what the bill would...

item.title: Months after Hurricane Helene, some North Carolinians still struggle to find housing
item.description: Eight months after Hurricane Helene, communities in western North Carolina still see evidence of the storm's destruction. For many, the biggest proble...

item.title: How a Los Angeles camp made space to let kids be kids after the wildfires
item.description: After the wildfires destroyed homes and disrupted routines, many parents saw behavioral shifts in their kids. Some families found support in a camp de...

item.title: Trump's $5 million Gold Card offers the rich a fast lane to residency
item.description: Foreign nationals with $5 million to spare will be able to register for a "gold card" visa that would give them the right to live and work in the U.S....

item.title: Fire kills 12 people reportedly locked inside drug rehab center
item.description: Officials believe cartels sometimes execute rival drug dealers as well as patients who refuse to join their ranks.

item.title: Lion kills man at luxury safari lodge after he left tent to use toilet
item.description: The victim was camping with other tourists at the tented resort when the early morning tragedy unfolded, police said.

item.title: Trump-backed conservative narrowly wins Poland's presidential election
item.description: Conservative Karol Nawrocki narrowly won Poland's presidential runoff election, beating Warsaw's liberal mayor, according to the final vote count. Naw...

item.title: Conservative historian wins Polish presidential vote
item.description: Right-wing historian Karol Nawrocki is Poland's new president, official results show.

item.title: WorldPride is in D.C. this year, prompting fears for some LGBTQ people
item.description: WorldPride is in D.C. this year, leaving the LGBTQ community conflicted about showing up to the nation's capital amid an administration that has targe...

item.title: Watch: Eyewitness captures video of Colorado attack scene
item.description: Eight people were injured after a man "started setting people on fire" at a mall in Boulder, Colorado, police say.

item.title: Ukraine drones strike bombers during major attack in Russia
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky claims the operation is Ukraine's biggest long-range attack of the war so far.

item.title: More than 700 believed dead in devastating Nigeria floods
item.description: About 500 people are still missing in the town of Mokwa, and officials fear no more survivors will be found.

item.title: GOP-friendly group putting millions into boosting support for Trump tax agenda
item.description: The House passed President Trump's "one, big, beautiful bill," which includes continuing the 2017 tax cuts, but several GOP senators have voiced conce...

item.title: Eight hurt in Colorado fire attack after suspect shouts 'free Palestine'
item.description: The FBI calls it a suspected terror attack and says the suspect used a makeshift flamethrower.

item.title: What we know about the suspect and victims in the Boulder, Colorado, attack
FBI says 8 injured in Colorado attack by man with makeshift flamethrower who yelled ‘Free Palestine’

item.title: Thousands evacuated in 3 provinces as Canadian wildfires threaten air quality into some US states
